Navico::Protocol::NRP::tImageClient Class Reference

Detailed Description

Class for controlling the state of the radar plus receiving spokes and state information.

Definition at line 30 of file ImageClient.h.

Navico::Protocol::NRP::tImageClient::tImageClient ( )
virtual Navico::Protocol::NRP::tImageClient::~tImageClient ( )

Member Function Documentation

int Navico::Protocol::NRP::tImageClient::Connect ( const char *  pSerialNumber,
unsigned  imageStream = 0 
)

Connects to the Radar with the specified SerialNumber.

Any existing connection will be automatically disconnected first. The radar must be unlocked before this operation can succeed (see MultiRadarClient.h). This will also create the threads required to listen on the connections made.

Parameters
pSerialNumberSerialNumber of the radar to connect to
imageStreamWhich image-stream/range of the radar to connect to.
Returns
0 if successfull, or one of the Protocol::eErrors (ClientErrors.h) enum values if failed
bool Navico::Protocol::NRP::tImageClient::Disconnect ( )

Disconnects from the radar.

Stops all threads and deinitialises all channels.

Returns
True if the operation was successful, False otherwise

bool Navico::Protocol::NRP::tImageClient::SetTransmit ( bool  state)

Set the transmission state of the radar.

This will also start the scanner rotating

Parameters
stateThe new state
Returns
True if the operation was successfully initiated
bool Navico::Protocol::NRP::tImageClient::SetTimedTransmit ( bool  state)

Set the timed transmission state of the radar.

This will cause the radar to alternately transmit for a period and then enter standby mode for a period of time. The transmit and standby periods must be set to valid values before this operation will have any effect (see SetTimedTransmitSetup).

Parameters
stateThe new timed transmit state
Returns
True if the operation was successfully initiated
bool Navico::Protocol::NRP::tImageClient::SetTimedTransmitSetup ( uint32_t  transmitPeriod_sec,
uint32_t  standbyPeriod_sec 
)

Setup the conditions for timed radar transmission.

Parameters
transmitPeriod_secThe number of seconds to transmit for
standbyPeriod_secThe number of seconds remain in standby for
Returns
True if the operation was successfully initiated
bool Navico::Protocol::NRP::tImageClient::SetRange ( uint32_t  range_m)

Set the new range in the radar.

Parameters
range_mThe new range expressed in meters
Returns
True if the operation was successfully initiated

bool Navico::Protocol::NRP::tImageClient::SetGain ( eUserGainManualAuto  type,
uint8_t  level 
)

Set the gain control.

Parameters
typeThe type of gain can be: eUserGainManual (in this situation the 'level' value will be applied), or eUserGainAuto (the radar will work in automatic gain mode)
levelThe value to use in manual gain mode (0-255)
Returns
True if the operation was successfully initiated
bool Navico::Protocol::NRP::tImageClient::SetSeaClutter ( eUserGainManualAuto  type,
uint8_t  level 
)

Set the sea clutter level.

Parameters
typeThe type of sea clutter can be: eUserGainManual (in this situation the 'level' value will be applied), eUserGainAutoHarbour (the radar will work in auto mode optimised for Harbour situations), or eUserGainAutoOffshore (the radar will work in auto mode optimised for offshore situations).
levelThe value to use in eUserGainManual mode (0-255)
Returns
True if the operation was successfully initiated
bool Navico::Protocol::NRP::tImageClient::SetSeaClutter ( eUserGainManualAuto  type,
uint8_t  level,
int8_t  autoOffset,
eUserGainValid  valid = UserGainValid_ALL 
)

Set the sea clutter level.

Parameters
typeThe type of sea clutter can be: eUserGainManual (in this situation the
levelvalue will be applied), eUserGainAuto (the radar will work in auto mode).
levelIt is the manual gain value (0-255)
autoOffsetIt is the automatic gain offset value (-128-127)
validIt is the bit mask for validity of supplied parameters: UserGainValid_Mode = update the manual/auto type, UserGainValid_Level = update the manual level, UserGainValid_Offset = update the auto offset. UserGainValid_ALL = update all three parameters.
Returns
True if the operation was successful
bool Navico::Protocol::NRP::tImageClient::SetSTCCurveType ( eStcCurveType  type)

Set the type of STC curve that will be applied in automatic sea clutter rejection.

Parameters
typeThe curve type to use, one of the eStcCurveType enum values.
Returns
True if the operation was successfully initiated

Set the rain clutter rejection level.

Parameters
levelThe manual gain value (0-255)
Returns
True if the operation was successfully initiated

bool Navico::Protocol::NRP::tImageClient::SetFastScanMode ( uint8_t  level)

Selects between normal and fast scanner rotation speeds.

Note that other controls, such as range and noise-reject, can restrict the maximum RPM available to lower than this setting.

Parameters
levelSelects one of the RPM rates: 0 normal/24rpm, 1 36rpm, or 2 48rpm
Returns
True if the operation was successfully initiated
bool Navico::Protocol::NRP::tImageClient::SetTargetStretch ( bool  state)

Set target stretch/expansion in SW.

Parameters
stateIf true, the target will appear larger, if false, with normal size
Returns
True if the operation was successfully initiated
bool Navico::Protocol::NRP::tImageClient::SetTargetStretch ( uint8_t  level)
Parameters
levelAmount of target-stretch to apply (0 none, up-to 3 high)
Returns
True if the operation was successful
bool Navico::Protocol::NRP::tImageClient::SetTargetBoost ( uint8_t  level)

Set target boost in hardware, changing physical parameters of the radar (pulse width or sweep length, for example).

Parameters
levelThe level of target boost desired. 0 = best target detail, 2 most target emphasis.
Returns
True if the operation was successfully initiated

bool Navico::Protocol::NRP::tImageClient::SetSectorBlanking ( uint32_t  sectorID,
bool  state 
)

If the scanner supports this mode, the scanner can be configured not to transmit in a specific sector of rotation.

Parameters
sectorIDsector ID
stateif false, the sector will be in off state, if true will be in on state
Returns
True if the operation was successful

)

If the scanner supports this mode, the scanner can be configured not to transmit in a specific sector of rotation.

stateif false, the sector will be in off state, if true will be in on state

Set the tune from automatic to manual.

If auto is set, it will start auto-tuning from the last manual value set

bool Navico::Protocol::NRP::tImageClient::SetGuardZoneSetup ( uint8_t  zone,
uint32_t  startRange_m,
uint32_t  endRange_m,
uint16_t  bearing_deg,
uint16_t  width_deg 
)

Sets up the size and location information for a guard zone.

Parameters
zoneGuard zone index/number (0 to cMaxGuardZones-1)
startRange_mStart of the sector, expressed in meters
endRange_mEnd of the sector, expressed in meters
bearing_degPosition of centre of the sector, expressed in degrees
width_degWidth of the sector, expressed in degrees (use 360 degrees to define a circular sector)
Returns
True if the operation was successfully initiated
bool Navico::Protocol::NRP::tImageClient::SetGuardZoneAlarmSetup ( uint8_t  zone,
eGuardZoneAlarmType  type 
)

Sets up the type of alarm for each guard zone.

Parameters
zoneGuard zone index/number (0 to cMaxGuardZones-1)
typeThe alarm type: eGZAlarmEntry (0) alarm only on targets entering the zone, eGZAlarmExit (1) alarm only on targets exiting, eGZAlarmBoth (2) alarm on targets both entering and exiting the zone
Returns
True if the operation was successfully initiated
bool Navico::Protocol::NRP::tImageClient::SetGuardZoneAlarmSuppress ( uint8_t  zone,
bool  state 
)

Suppress an alarm coming from guard zone system.

Parameters
zoneGuard zone index/number (0 to cMaxGuardZones-1)
stateIf false, suppresses the alarm, if true, unsupresses the alarm
Returns
True if the operation was successfully initiated
bool Navico::Protocol::NRP::tImageClient::SetGuardZoneAlarmCancel ( uint8_t  zone,
eGuardZoneAlarmType  type 
)

Cancels an alarm coming from guard zone system.

Parameters
zoneGuard zone index/number (0 to cMaxGuardZones-1)
typeType of alarm we want to cancel: eGZAlarmEntry (0) or eGZAlarmExit (1)
Returns
True if the operation was successfully initiated
bool Navico::Protocol::NRP::tImageClient::SetGuardZoneSensitivity ( uint8_t  level)

Sets up the sensitivity of guard zones.

Parameters
levelThe level of sensitivity. 0 = no sensitivity, 255 = max sensitivity
Returns
True if the operation was successfully initiated
